rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
In an extension known as per-VLAN spanning tree (PVST), Layer 2 Ethernet ports can use STP on all VLANs. Rapid-PVST+, enabled by default on each configured VLAN (provided you do not manually disable it), uses RSTP to provide faster convergence. Independent VLANs run their own RSTP instance. 

The Runbook is for show your P-VLAN spanning tree(PVST/RPVST/PVST+) switch and other information.
1. Highlight PVST
2. Highlight PVST Configuration
3. Highlight Spanning Tree Features
4. Highlight VLAN

References:
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/ios/15-4SY/config_guide/sup6T/15_3_sy_swcg_6T/spanning_tree.html"},"insert":"PVST Information"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
In an extension known as per-VLAN spanning tree (PVST), Layer 2 Ethernet ports can use STP on all VLANs. Rapid-PVST+, enabled by default on each configured VLAN (provided you do not manually disable it), uses RSTP to provide faster convergence. Independent VLANs run their own RSTP instance. 

The Runbook is for show your P-VLAN spanning tree(PVST/RPVST/PVST+) switch and other information.
1. Highlight PVST
2. Highlight PVST Configuration
3. Highlight Spanning Tree Features
4. Highlight VLAN

References:
PVST Information

References:
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst6500/ios/15-4SY/config_guide/sup6T/15_3_sy_swcg_6T/spanning_tree.html"},"insert":"PVST Information"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
In an extension known as per-VLAN spanning tree (PVST), Layer 2 Ethernet ports can use STP on all VLANs. Rapid-PVST+, enabled by default on each configured VLAN (provided you do not manually disable it), uses RSTP to provide faster convergence. Independent VLANs run their own RSTP instance. 

The Runbook is for show your P-VLAN spanning tree(PVST/RPVST/PVST+) switch and other information.
1. Highlight PVST
2. Highlight PVST Configuration
3. Highlight Spanning Tree Features
4. Highlight VLAN

References:
PVST Information
